alert.note: Alert for Banner; Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 11 at 4:57AM CST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HAZARDOUS TRAVEL CONDITIONS FROM OCCASIONAL LIGHT SNOW AND FREEZING DRIZZLE TONIGHT THROUGH EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... A Pacific system and polar cold front will bring colder air and light snow to the area starting late this afternoon. Although precipitation rates are expected to be low, snow accumulations around one inch, patchy fog, and light freezing drizzle will likely result in hazardous travel conditions starting Monday evening and continuing through Tuesday morning. Motorists and travelers are urged to use caution, especially while traveling across high elevation passes and bridges. Light snow and freezing drizzle could lead to icy roadways and slick conditions.
